info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 3:14AM PDT until March 28 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM PDT TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...In western Modoc County, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches. For the rest of Modoc County, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting to around 30 to 50 mph. * WHERE...For the warning area, Western Modoc County including Tionesta, Day and portions of Highway 139 northwest of Canby. For the Advisory, this includes portions of central and eastern Modoc County including Canby, Lookout as well as areas near and over the Warner Mountains. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall is expected late Tuesday night through Tuesday morning. Snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour Monday night through Tuesday morning. The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
